intro: Pseudognaphalium micradenium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed.
